page.title: 18ST. BARNABAS ANGLICAN CHURCH
page.content: This Anglican Church was built four years ago at a cost of '325,000.Its site was chosen because most of the parishioners of its mother church All Saints now live this end of the parish. It was designed by Rod Robinson assisted by the parish priest Rev.Hugh Broad and his wife. It has two halls which have a number of parish and removing a partition can be used to enlarge the church which normally holds 60 people, enabling it to hold 250. The Church was consecrated by the Bishop of Hereford and the church halls opened by Princess Margret. The Church has a bell which came from a former temporary church of St. Barnabas; demolished in 1968. The sanctuary light designed by Mrs.Broad was a gift in memory of those who died in the Falklands War.
